page.title: 17A LOCAL WILDLIFE SANCTUARY
page.content: Shaldon Wildlife Park is situated near the Ness and opened in I965. There are over a 100 animals many of which are rare breeds. For example there are only 7 Lemurs in England and the Park has 2 of them, a male and female which they hope will breed. The animals are mainly small breeds and range from Harvest Mice to Monkey Gibbons and from Mynah Birds to Great Eagle Owls. The owner's favourite animal is the Coati because it is a brillant escape artist and is usually to be found on top of the cage. Every week the animals consume over 1,000 insects and 100 pounds of fruit. In order to help cover the cost of this the Park is a registered charity and they sell badges, puzzles, posters etc. One of the main aims of the Park is to educate people to live with animals.
